channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Caretaker, 20th June
item.description:
We pay a service charge for WHAT?? Your roster for cleaning is not being followed by no body lifts moped once a week if that lobbies not cleaned walkways not swept all that happens is the rubbish gets collected Reported quit a few times now so can management take a visit please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Attlee Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes. Deep, wide, old and new., 20th June
item.description:
Lots and lots of potholes are opening in Craigerne Rd. Some of them have been marked with white paint months ago, which probably means that at some point the idea of filling them must have crossed the mind of someone at the Council. But, no. They are still there and they keep being a huge source of danger, particularly for cyclists at night. Some of them are more than one foot deep.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Craigerne Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of waste, probably domestic, dumped on corner of Lavender Grove and Malvern Road, 20th June
item.description:
The waste was dumped earlier in the week. Since then the foxes have been at it. I have now rebagged it, as best I could. It's getting a bit smelly! Interesting that they have used white Hackney bags.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish always dumped here, 20th June
item.description:
Rubbish is always dumped here. It started with an old gate, and a windowm and now everyone just seems to drop their rubbish here. The people who own the garages have been seen leaving stuff here too - it's not fair. They don't have to look at it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glyn Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Bexley Woods Sewage smell, 20th June
item.description:
There is a constant smell of sewage coming from the main rainwater gulley. This can be smelt in the gardens nearby as well as walking in the woods. On the map is the exact pinpoint location of the huge drain. Please can this be investigated and cleaned. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Bridgen Road, Bexley, London

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No delivery/loading on red route, 20th June
item.description:
For 2 years I’ve been living at my address and it’s absolute hell trying to get anything delivered. There’s random car parking bays on the street with free parking. I would like to propose that one or more of the bays are turned into a loading only bay. This will mean I can finally have my medicines and deliveries delivered. In the last 12 months I’ve had 70 deliveries rescheduled and/or missed. I’m happy to discuss solutions, it doesn’t seem right that one person puts out mini-cones so they can park in the street for free in this day and age.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 138, Archway Road, Crouch End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing Neglect of Canal Maintenance – Request for Immediate Action, 20th June
item.description:
I am writing to express my ongoing concern regarding the current state of the canal. Despite previous requests for the removal of accumulated rubbish and excessive aquatic vegetation, no visible action has been taken to address the issue. The presence of rubbish in the canal not only detracts from the visual appearance of the area but also poses significant environmental and public health risks. Waste material, particularly plastics and other non-biodegradable debris, contributes to water pollution, harms local wildlife, and may obstruct natural water flow, increasing the risk of localised flooding. Furthermore, the unchecked growth of aquatic weeds and algae is exacerbating the problem. These invasive plants deplete oxygen levels in the water, threaten native species, and can cause blockages that hinder water movement. Over time, such conditions can lead to stagnant, foul-smelling water, creating an unpleasant and potentially hazardous environment for nearby residents. Given the above, I respectfully urge to prioritise the cleaning and maintenance of this waterway as a matter of urgency. Regular upkeep of the canal is essential not only for environmental sustainability but also for the wellbeing of the local community. I would appreciate a written response confirming when the required work will be carried out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
